pullRequest.title: Remove dependence of Inlining table relocations on the existence of virtual guards
pullRequest.bodyText:
See #11060 for details.
The idea of this PR is:

Leave the relocation of guards and the inlining table entry coupled
Maintain relocation information for each inlining entry as we create it - use incInlineDepth to store information the "withoutNopGuard" relocations need
If a guard doesn't exist for a given callsite, use the information stored for that callsite to generate one of the "withoutNopGuard" relocation

Create "withoutNopGuard" relocations for Static, Special, and Abstract inlined methods (Virtual and Interface already exist)



Depends on eclipse/omr#5729
Depends on (and therefore currently contains commits from) #11235
Closes #11060

nodes.bodyText: This looks weird. Why do you need to explicitly call the base class for a virtual method?
Shouldn't the default reloKind be that returned by OMR's version of this function (i.e. not inlining the current implementation of it) ?
Please augment the comment to summarize the refactoring and reason why it's being refactored?
Is there a reason you wanted all these functions to be static and not functions of J9::CodeGenerator?
Should this version only be in use if the SVM is not being used?
Just to confirm: you're mapping all relocations to the earliest and outermost inlined site index with the same method?
why remove the comment which explains a relatively subtle ordering point?
Maybe add a "should be done first" to this comment, and explain why?
better not have virtual methods (i'm sure it doesn't, but...)

We were never calling TR_RelocationRecordInlinedVirtualMethod::getMethodFromCP when the relo kind was TR_InlinedVirtualMethod because this virtual method was missing the TR_OpaqueMethodBlock *callerMethod param; TR_RelocationRecordInlinedMethod::getMethodFromCP ended up getting called, which would just cause a load failure...
do you still need this typedef?
do you still need this typedef?
helpers that read and then update state in the code generator object. But ok, I don't feel that strongly about it.
by your earlier logic, wouldn't this list be empty if not using SVM?

i meant TR_RelocationRecordInformation. Wouldn't it be better to initialize this structure with a placement new, which would also have the benefit of initializing any vft needed? I'm not that concerned about it, but it's not a completely outrageous evolution someone could dream up :) .
do you still need this typedef?

commit.message:
Add new relocation records for inlined methods without guards

Currently, there is a coupling between the relocation of the inlining
table in the J9JITExceptionTable struct and inlined method guards; as a
consequence, if a guard was removed in a way that the AOT infrastructure
was not aware of, the associated inlined method would not get relocated.

This commit facilitates removing the dependence on guards by adding
relocation records for inlined methods that may not have a guard. There
already exists such records for Interface and Virtual methods; this
commit adds records for Special, Static, and Abstract methods as well.

Signed-off-by: Irwin D'Souza <dsouzai.gh@gmail.com>

Add missing param to TR_RelocationRecordInlinedVirtualMethod::getMethodFromCP

Because TR_RelocationRecordInlinedVirtualMethod::getMethodFromCP was
missing the currentMethod param, when the relo type is
TR_InlinedVirtualMethod, the call to getMethodFromCP ends up going to
TR_RelocationRecordInlinedMethod::getMethodFromCP which unconditionally
returns NULL, which ensures that the AOT load fails. This commit fixes
this bug.

Signed-off-by: Irwin D'Souza <dsouzai.gh@gmail.com>

Use new incInlineDepth API

Use the new incInlineDepth API to ensure that the inlined site contains
all the information needed for relocation in case a guard does not exist
for that site. Additionally, add an assert in the old API to ensure that
it is not called except for when the callsite is not actually
incremented (such as when estimating the bytecode size in the inliner
prior to actually inlining).

Signed-off-by: Irwin D'Souza <dsouzai.gh@gmail.com>

Extend API to provide relo type for method to be inlined

The default implementation in OMR is to return TR_NoRelocation. However,
in OpenJ9 we need to be able to specify the relo type for the current
inlined site in case there isn't a guard available. Therefore, this API
is extended to determine the type of the relocation needed.

Signed-off-by: Irwin D'Souza <dsouzai.gh@gmail.com>

Refactor J9::CodeGenerator::processRelocations

processRelocations is a very big method that does a lot of different
tasks. In order to make the code easier to read, this commit refactors
this method. Now, each helper method has a well defined role.

Signed-off-by: Irwin D'Souza <dsouzai.gh@gmail.com>

Change data passed in to inlining table relocations

Because an inlined site may not have a guard, this commit changes the
data that's passed in when creating the external relocation. Previously
the virtual guard would be passed in, which would be used to acquire all
the necessary information; now the data is put into a
TR_RelocationRecordInformation struct first, and this struct is passed
into the external relocation.

Signed-off-by: Irwin D'Souza <dsouzai.gh@gmail.com>

Increment JITServer Minor Version

Change in relocation requires a change to the minor version.

Signed-off-by: Irwin D'Souza <dsouzai.gh@gmail.com>
